page.title: 16STAUNTON ON WYE CHURCH
page.content: STAUNTON ON WYE CHURCH The anglican church is away form the main village up a steep path and can be difficult for elderly people to attend. There are 3 services a month, average attendance 8-10 with more at Festivals. The vicar, Mr Rees, lives in Staunton. There is also a well - attended Methodist Chapel and joint prayer meetings are held fortnightly at a home near the almshouses for the old people there. There is a good peal of bells, often rung by local and visiting teams of ringers. A special churchyard fund was set up 6 years ago with donations collected for keeping the grass mown and tidy. The church - yard is a peaceful resting place with its headstones, yew trees and wild flowers in their season.
